intro: Chrysanthemum adenanthum, commonly known as the desert chrysanthemum, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing perennial that produces small, yellow to orange flowers during the spring and summer months. The plant has a fibrous root system adapted to survive in dry conditions, and its leaves are typically narrow and covered in fine hairs. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its ability to thrive in sandy or rocky soils. Its botanical features make it well-suited for xeriscaping and habitat restoration in desert environments.
